intro: Ternstroemia baracoensis, commonly known as the Bornean ternstroemia, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Theaceae, which includes camellias and other ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are typically elliptical and glossy. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Due to its restricted habitat, Ternstroemia baracoensis is considered a rare and endangered species.
